WRITING.TITLE: Actex Exams for exam P!
WRITING.TEXT: Hello guys, hope you find this in your good health. Im currently studying for exam P and was going through the actex exams, things were really cool until Actex Exam 8. Some questions on that were super difficult for me. Keep in mind i have done all SOA sample questions. So i was wondering is the exam generally as hard as Actex Exam 8? Also, IF you have done both actex exams and adapt, what EL do you think Actex Exam 8 is? Should i still go for Adapt? Thankyou for reading this. #10084; #65039;

Failing exam P is very common, so dont go so hard on yourself. I actually had a very similar experience as you in my first sitting but for studying for the second time for Exam P i realized that I really didn #8217;t practice enough problems. Take some rest, and then start practicing alot. SOA #8217;s sample, 8 Actex Exams, ASM exams. You should have practice of atleast 1000-1200 questions to know just enough to pass P. Best of luck. :)
Sorry bro, it #8217;s the end for you im afraid. Haha
Thankyou good sir!
Shutup.
Possible since you have a strong background. Just practise alot of questions. And by alot i mean atleast 1000 questions. Also, isnt the deadline date till 10 December??

WRITING.TITLE: Demotivated.
WRITING.TEXT: Hello, good people. Hope this post find you in your good health. I am studying for exam P and hoping to appear in January examination session. I am done with SOA samples, Actex Exams 1-8. So i decided before going for Adapt ill go through ASM exams too, it was okay until exam 6 came along. I am really struggling in this exam. Most of the stuff is so new (which is surprising because i have done around 600 questions already) and is so difficult. My question is that do SOA exam are really this hard? Or even harder? This is demoralising me and is making me think I shouldn #8217;t sit for january exam. Please guide. Thankyou. Really depressed. Sorry if there is any grammatical mistake.

WRITING.TITLE: Exam P January 2020.
WRITING.TEXT: Anyone here who is registered to sit for exam P in january? Let #8217;s all share our preparation uptill now for the exam and come back here after the exam and see whether we did enough or not. Ill start: #8226; Actex Manual and questions #8226; Soa exams #8226; Actex Exams 1-8 #8226; Asm Exams 1-10 (yet) Thinking to go for all 20 exams and ADAPT. What do you all think? Best of luck! #10084; #65039; Oh also, Happyyy new year! #10084; #65039;
I think it #8217;s better if you start with ASM. It deals with alot of concepts that no other has. Then go for Actex. You do this and youll cover the whole syllabus.
ASM is more than enough to cover the syllabus, Actex is helplful with it #8217;s 8 practice exams. Otherwise you can go with either.

Hello. I #8217;m sorry if this seems low effort to you. I only wanted flash cards because im currently grinding on practice problems so much that even going to sleep makes me feel guilty. Hence I thought having flash cards and reading them while going to bed would make me less panic. Also if it is the fact that i asked those flash cards to be free then just know that i belong to a 3rd world country and have already spent my 2 months salary on registration and ADAPT and cant afford failure. Anyways, thankyou for nothing.
Congratulations brother
Bro you must have failed by like a question or two (MAX) if you were at 6.5 EL. Take some rest, binge watch some shows and then restart. You #8217;ll clear next time! #128077; #127996;

WRITING.TITLE: Exam FM.
WRITING.TEXT: Hello guys, i passed my exam P in Jan. And now I #8217;m starting for FM. The learning content in FM is like 10x more than P. So i was just wondering how long did it take you guys to complete FM preparation (along with practice exams)? Is it possible to sit for June? Also, tips for studying FM! Thankyou #10084; #65039;
Instead of breaking up with her, ask for another threesome but this time with a female friend of her. Fuck her friend. And then end the goddamn relationship.

Apart from Adapt which, in my opinion, shouldnt be used till last month of exam, there are plenty of practice materials. You can easily find: SOA sample 333. 8 Actex practice exams. 20 ASM practice exams. 4 TIA Exams. These might look alot but you have aloooot of time to easily learn these exams and get comfortable with your sitting. The only way to pass exam P is to practice as much as you can. P.S. dont take practice exams under exam conditions.
I can study 35-40hrs a week lol
Chad Green all the way
How long and how much did you study for FM? Kindly share.
oh damn.. thats cruel. Not that i rate EL system alot but still getting to EL 8 is hard. I think you probably missed the exam by a question or two (max).
My girlfriend have hiiiiiiiigh level of estradiol #128546;

Exam P #8217;s syllabus isn #8217;t that difficult but the practice problems... woosh. They are super hard. Can make you pull out all your hair. I did about 1500 different type of questions and still wasnt fully sure of passing it. Trick is to do as many practice problems and review them every time. Everytime. CA actually does a really good job in reviewing it. However, checkout Mancinelli Maths Lab on youtube too.

EL is a scam. Take custom quizzes on the topics youre struggling and work on it. I have seen people with EL 8 failing and people with EL lt; 3 passing it only because they review it much more than the others

Sorry for late reply. The reason i said that because taking me practice exam under exam conditions would only be sensible if you were fully prepared. Relax yourself and instead of doing 30 questions in 3 hrs. Give them the whole day and review every question. You can take adapt exams later under exam conditions. Dont worry about how long youre putting in one question because right now youre just learning the mechanics. Best of luck.
Feel like thats entirely different. I have done Alevels and was thinking to pursue actuarial science instead of BS degree
Just to simply answer your question, grad school is actually worth it.

a what?
Would really recommend going through SOA 300 questions before adapt and then IF you have some remaining time go through TIA 4 free exams.

Hi, if you #8217;re properly reviewing them then dont be worried for your EL or passing grade, just make sure you actually review the questions and fully understand the concept first. You have time for 4 FREE TIA exams, i think you should try them too as they have video solutions tooo. Review them too. Best of luck

WRITING.TITLE: Exam FM
WRITING.TEXT: Hi, im thinking to sit for FM in October and just got done with my ASM manual. Do you think a month (35 days) will be enough to go through all the practice exams questions and pass? I #8217;m thinking to do: #8226;)SOA sample #8226;)ASM 6 exams. #8226;)TIA free exams #8226;) ADAPT 7 days. For context: I have passed P and study around 4hrs a day. Also, do you think these practice exams are enough to pass FM? TIA! #10084; #65039;
drop him

Focus on one thing at a time and the most important thing right now is that you pass the exams first. The exams are very hard but definitely doable. Youll probably start with Exam P? If yes then youd definitely will have to put alot of work in. For context it took me around 1400 practise questions to pass it with a 7. Best of luck!!

WRITING.TITLE: Softwares for an actuary.
WRITING.TEXT: Hello guys, i am here for suggestions. My FM exam was postponed so now i have a bit of free time and i want to utilise it. I am looking for learning softwares/programs that will help me in actuarial work-field and improve my CV aswell. Should i master myself in excel? What do you all suggest i should learn and from where? (Udemy, TIA etc). TIA #10084; #65039;

You really underestimated P. P needs tons of practise, you might know all the concepts but how and where to apply them is what SOA tests us on. Their wordings is tricky and hardly a question is just easy data to plug in the formulas. Dont worry, it happens to the best of us. Good luck

SOA sample questions have about 5 SF questions. Do you want me to tell you the numbers of those Qs?

WRITING.TITLE: Why do people fail FM?
WRITING.TEXT: Hi, I **passed** my P exam in January, and since July have been studying for my FM exam. I was supposed to sit for the exam in October but due to covid-19, it was postponed till December which means I have a lot more time to prepare. However, unlike Exam P the syllabus of FM is way easier and all the questions are really way easier to solve. Very rarely I have to look at solutions to the questions. Now, all this made me super confident about my exam until I recently met a few of my seniors who all had to sit for FM at least twice or more. This made me question if there is something that I am missing in my preparation? Has anyone who has failed FM on their first try after feeling super confident guide me what more should I do to ensure I pass FM on my first try? TIA! Edit: I am sorry if someone find this offensive, I honestly didnt mean to at all. I passed exam P on my second attempt and since I live in a 3rd world country and cover all my expenses myself I want to avoid any sort of chance of failing FM like i failed P. Still, i apologise.
you know what, thank you. You were right. I downloaded the 2018 SOA sample thinking it would be the most updated one (Since they removed SF in 2017). Thank you, brother
Check my edit
